articles.headline: MSNBC Changes Prime-Time Lineup
articles.snippet: MSNBC is removing the longtime host Dan Abrams — its onetime general manager — from his 9 p.m. program and replacing him with Rachel Maddow.
articles.abstract: MSNBC is removing the longtime host Dan Abrams — its onetime general manager — from his 9 p.m. program and replacing him with Rachel Maddow.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just in time for the closing rush of the presidential election, MSNBC is shaking up its prime-time programming lineup, removing the longtime host Dan Abrams  its onetime general manager  from his 9 p.m. program and replacing him with Rachel Maddow, who has emerged as a favored political commentator for the all-news cable network.

articles.headline: Owner Gives Executives Time to Fix Chrysler
articles.snippet: Top Chrysler executives are determined to fix the company, and executives at Cerberus Capital, Chrysler’s new private-equity owner, say they will get the chance.
articles.abstract: Top Chrysler executives are determined to fix the company, and executives at Cerberus Capital, Chrysler’s new private-equity owner, say they will get the chance.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — When the economy soured and gas prices soared, no auto company seemed in a worse position than Chrysler.

articles.headline: Home Repairs Become Focus as Consumers Feel Pinched
articles.snippet: With the housing market in the doldrums and inflation running at a pace unseen in nearly two decades, consumers are not buying new homes. Instead they are focusing on repairs.
articles.abstract: With the housing market in the doldrums and inflation running at a pace unseen in nearly two decades, consumers are not buying new homes. Instead they are focusing on repairs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Suddenly, the theme in home goods retailing is “in with the old.”

articles.headline: Obama’s Ads in Key States Go on Attack
articles.snippet: Barack Obama has started a hard-hitting ad campaign against John McCain in vital states, painting Mr. McCain as disconnected from middle-class struggles.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama has started a hard-hitting ad campaign against John McCain in vital states, painting Mr. McCain as disconnected from middle-class struggles.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Barack Obama has started a sustained and hard-hitting advertising campaign against Senator John McCain in states that will be vital this fall, painting Mr. McCain in a series of commercials as disconnected from the economic struggles of the middle class.

articles.headline: Some Investors Say U.S. Bailout of Housing Giants Is Inevitable
articles.snippet: Shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac declined almost 25 percent on concerns that the companies will need a bailout from the federal government.
articles.abstract: Shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac declined almost 25 percent on concerns that the companies will need a bailout from the federal government.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shares of the mortgage finance giants, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, declined almost 25 percent on Wednesday on concerns that the companies will need a bailout from the federal government.
articles.byline: By Charles Duhigg and Vikas Bajaj

articles.headline: Survivors in Georgia Tell of Ethnic Killings
articles.snippet: Now that the fighting between Georgia and Russia has subsided, killings will be grist for competing claims of ethnic cleansing.
articles.abstract: Now that the fighting between Georgia and Russia has subsided, killings will be grist for competing claims of ethnic cleansing.
articles.lead_paragraph: TKVIAVI, Georgia — The men who came to Gulnara Militaura’s house seemed to know what they were looking for. They entered her kitchen and shot her husband and his brother in the head. For the next five days, as attacks and looting raged outside, she cowered at home, sprinkling vinegar on the bodies to try to keep them from rotting.

articles.headline: Palm, Once a Leader, Seeks Path in Smartphone Jungle
articles.snippet: Palm is trying to revive itself as business users have embraced the BlackBerry and consumers have fallen in love with the iPhone.
articles.abstract: Palm is trying to revive itself as business users have embraced the BlackBerry and consumers have fallen in love with the iPhone.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — If anyone knows how best to survive a corporate near-death experience, it is Jon Rubinstein.
